title: EVS MOD 1
description: A collection of questions covering forest, desert, river, ocean, and wetland ecosystems, as well as the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

questions.text: What is the primary producer in a forest ecosystem?
Which layer of the forest canopy receives the most sunlight?
Which of the following organisms is considered a decomposer in a forest ecosystem?
Which of the following best describes the role of fungi in the forest ecosystem?
What is the primary function of a forest's understory layer?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the forest floor ecosystem?
What is the term for the variety of species within a forest ecosystem?
Which of the following is a characteristic of a healthy forest ecosystem?
What is the role of apex predators in forest ecosystems?
What is the term for the relationship where one organism benefits while the other is unaffected in a forest ecosystem?
Which of the following adaptations is most common among plants in desert ecosystems?
options: Deep root systems to access groundwater

questions.text: What is the primary limiting factor for plant growth in deserts?
Which type of animal is often considered a keystone species in desert ecosystems?
How do desert plants reduce water loss?
options: By having large leaves to store water
By opening stomata during the day
By conducting photosynthesis only at night
By having thick waxy cuticles on their leaves

questions.text: What is the primary source of energy for most desert ecosystems?
Which of the following desert animals is primarily nocturnal to avoid extreme daytime temperatures?
What is the term for the process by which desert soils become encrusted with salts due to evaporation?
How do desert plants adapt to survive in extreme temperatures?
options: By storing water in their stems
By having broad leaves to capture sunlight
By shedding their leaves during dry periods

questions.text: What is the primary function of desert-dwelling animals' burrows?
How do desert plants maximize water absorption?
options: By closing stomata during the day
By relying on rainfall for hydration

questions.text: Which of the following organisms is considered a primary producer in a river ecosystem?
What is the primary function of riparian vegetation in river ecosystems?
Which of the following organisms is an example of a benthic macroinvertebrate in a river ecosystem?
What is the term for the zone of a river where freshwater and saltwater mix?
What is the primary role of decomposers in a river ecosystem?
Which of the following is NOT a function of wetlands within river ecosystems?
What is the term for the area where a river meets the ocean or a lake?
Which of the following is an example of a secondary consumer in a river ecosystem?
What is the term for the process by which nutrients and organic matter are transported downstream in a river ecosystem?
Which of the following is an example of a lotic habitat in a river ecosystem?
Which of the following is the primary producer in ocean ecosystems?
What is the primary function of coral reefs in ocean ecosystems?
options: Supporting biodiversity and providing habitat for various marine species

questions.text: Which of the following organisms is considered a top predator in the ocean ecosystem?
What is the term for the zone of the ocean where sunlight penetrates and photosynthesis occurs?
What is the primary role of zooplankton in ocean ecosystems?
Which of the following is NOT a function of mangrove forests in coastal ocean ecosystems?
options: Protecting coastlines from erosion and storm damage
Providing habitat for juvenile fish and marine invertebrates

questions.text: What is the term for the area of the ocean where the water is too deep for sunlight to penetrate?
Which of the following is an example of a pelagic habitat in the ocean ecosystem?
What is the term for the process by which dissolved nutrients are cycled between the ocean surface and deeper layers?
Which of the following organisms is an example of a filter feeder in the ocean ecosystem?
What is the primary role of wetlands in the ecosystem?
Which of the following is a characteristic of wetland soils?
What is the primary function of wetland vegetation?
Which of the following organisms is commonly found in wetland ecosystems and is known for its loud mating calls?
What is the term for the transition zone between a wetland and a terrestrial ecosystem?
Which of the following wetland types is characterized by saturated soils and acidic water, often found in northern regions?
What is the primary function of wetlands in flood control?
Which of the following ecosystem services is NOT provided by wetlands?
What is the primary function of wetlands in nutrient cycling?
Which of the following wetland plants is commonly used for phytoremediation to remove pollutants from water?
When were the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) officially adopted by the United Nations?
How many Sustainable Development Goals are there in total?
What is the primary purpose of the SDGs?
Which of the following is NOT one of the SDGs?
Which SDG aims to ensure access to safe and affordable drinking water for all?
What is the deadline for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals?
Which SDG aims to promote sustained, inclusive, and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment, and decent work for all?
options: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

questions.text: What is the term used to describe the collective efforts and resources needed to achieve the SDGs?
Which SDG aims to reduce inequality within and among countries?
options: SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions

questions.text: What is the term used to describe the process of building the knowledge, skills, and institutional capacities needed to achieve sustainable development goals?
Which SDG focuses on ending poverty in all its forms everywhere?
Which SDG aims to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all?
Which SDG aims to promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all, and build effective, accountable, and inclusive institutions at all levels?
options: SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions

questions.text: Which SDG aims to conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas, and marine resources for sustainable development?

Which SDG aims to protect, restore, and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, halt and reverse land degradation, and halt biodiversity loss?
options: SDG 16: Peace, Justice, and Strong Institutions

questions.text: Which SDG aims to ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all?
options: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

questions.text: Which SDG aims to reduce the adverse impacts of climate change and take urgent action to combat its effects?
Which SDG aims to strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development?
